channel.title: Editing a file online
channel.description: Hey, I'm doing something that include keeping data online. Well, I don't want to go through all the hassle with MySQL so can someone tell me how to edit a file that is online, say www.stupidfiles.com/myaccount/myfile.txt, and I want to edit it using a Java applet. I don't think it is possible, but you never know.

item.title: Editing a file online
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

Well, just looked through that site and since I have dial up, I’m going to stick to the MySQL Driver that I already have downloaded. I guess I’ll just use a MySQL db since I’m already set up for that. Ty for suggestions.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing a file online
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:15, topic:222835”][quote author=the bank link=topic=292671.msg2358371#msg2358371 date=1217453907]

[quote author=Pwnd link=topic=292671.msg2358079#msg2358079 date=1217437155]

My advice is to do all encryption/decryption at the php level so they can’t get access to it.
[/quote]That doesn’t make a lot of sense

I don’t think encryption is as necessary as input validation.
[/quote]He is editing “myFile.txt” via “myScript.php” via “myJavaClass.class”. The unenecrypted information is sent to a the secure PHP script which it is then encrypted and then parsed to the txt file.

To get the value, you pass the encrypted text back through the PHP script, and return the value in you java class.

But if someone gets the location of the php script, they can just do the same calls the applet does and get any information they want to.[/quote]But that is java. There is nothing you can do to bypass that problem. The safest way is the way i described and to keep your code obfuscated and keep availability to a minimum.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing a file online
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:13, topic:222835”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=292671.msg2358079#msg2358079 date=1217437155]

[quote author=the bank link=topic=292671.msg2357845#msg2357845 date=1217422737]
My advice is to do all encryption/decryption at the php level so they can’t get access to it.
[/quote]That doesn’t make a lot of sense

I don’t think encryption is as necessary as input validation.
[/quote]He is editing “myFile.txt” via “myScript.php” via “myJavaClass.class”. The unenecrypted information is sent to a the secure PHP script which it is then encrypted and then parsed to the txt file.

To get the value, you pass the encrypted text back through the PHP script, and return the value in you java class.[/quote]

But if someone gets the location of the php script, they can just do the same calls the applet does and get any information they want to.

Read full topic

I don’t think encryption is as necessary as input validation.
[/quote]He is editing “myFile.txt” via “myScript.php” via “myJavaClass.class”. The unenecrypted information is sent to a the secure PHP script which it is then encrypted and then parsed to the txt file.

To get the value, you pass the encrypted text back through the PHP script, and return the value in you java class.[/quote]
Exactly.

but pwnd is right too, I gotta use session ID’s because the information will be sent from an applet on another site completely.

To get the value, you pass the encrypted text back through the PHP script, and return the value in you java class.

item.title: Editing a file online

item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“pizza pie, post:9, topic:222835”]Yah yakman showed me my problems. I’ve made Encryption and Decryption classes so that everything I send over the internet, using Java, will be encrypted and turned into byte arrays. Way harder for nub packet sniffers…[/quote]Well, the problems is if they get the hands on the encryption/decryption methods

Read full topic

item.title: Editing a file online
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

Yah yakman showed me my problems. I’ve made Encryption and Decryption classes so that everything I send over the internet, using Java, will be encrypted and turned into byte arrays. Way harder for nub packet sniffers…

item.title: Editing a file online
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:6, topic:222835”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=292671.msg2357114#msg2357114 date=1217373023]

[quote author=the bank link=topic=292671.msg2357108#msg2357108 date=1217371908]
Your best bet is PHP.
[/quote]Or having Java interact with PHP. (Unless, of course, that’s what you meant)
[/quote]Yea, either POST data to the PHP page, or simply connect to it.[/quote]And make sure you secure it, because that’d be exploitable as hell.

Read full topic
